column1: Distant Supervision for Relation Extraction with Linear Attenuation Simulation and Non-IID Relevance Embedding
AAAI Technical Track: Natural Language Processing
Distant supervision for relation extraction is an efficient method to reduce labor costs and has been widely used to seek novel relational facts in large corpora
column2: which can be identified as a multi-instance multi-label problem. However
column3: existing distant supervision methods suffer from selecting important words in the sentence and extracting valid sentences in the bag. Towards this end
column4: we propose a novel approach to address these problems in this paper. Firstly
column5: we propose a linear attenuation simulation to reflect the importance of words in the sentence with respect to the distances between entities and words. Secondly
column6: we propose a non-independent and identically distributed (non-IID) relevance embedding to capture the relevance of sentences in the bag. Our method can not only capture complex information of words about hidden relations
column7: but also express the mutual information of instances in the bag. Extensive experiments on a benchmark dataset have well-validated the effectiveness of the proposed method.
